content:
TITLE: Installing Minikube Beta on Linux S390x using Debian package
DESCRIPTION: Downloads and installs the latest beta version of Minikube for Linux S390x architecture using a Debian package. This method fetches the latest beta release URL from GitHub API and requires root privileges to install the package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_23

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
r=https://api.github.com/repos/kubernetes/minikube/releases
u=$(curl -s $r | grep -o 'http.*download/v.*beta.*/minikube_.*_s390x.deb' | head -n1)
curl -L $u > minikube_beta_s390x.deb && sudo dpkg -i minikube_beta_s390x.deb
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deleting Minikube Cluster
DESCRIPTION: Removes the local Minikube cluster. This command deletes all resources associated with the current Minikube cluster.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/controls.md#2025-04-18_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube delete
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing minikube on Linux x86-64 (Stable Debian Package)
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to download and install the stable version of minikube for Linux x86-64 architecture using Debian package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -LO https://storage.googleapis.com/minikube/releases/latest/minikube_latest_amd64.deb
sudo dpkg -i minikube_latest_amd64.deb
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Minikube on Linux S390x using RPM package
DESCRIPTION: Downloads and installs the latest stable version of Minikube for Linux S390x architecture using an RPM package. This method requires root privileges to install the package using rpm.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_24

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -LO https://storage.googleapis.com/minikube/releases/latest/minikube-latest.s390x.rpm
sudo rpm -Uvh minikube-latest.s390x.rpm
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Docker Images in Minikube using SSH
DESCRIPTION: Command for building Docker images directly inside the Minikube node after accessing it via SSH. This builds against the same Docker daemon that the Kubernetes cluster is using.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/pushing.md#2025-04-18_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Minikube on Windows x86-64 using .exe download
DESCRIPTION: Downloads and installs the latest stable version of Minikube for Windows x86-64 using an executable installer. It also provides PowerShell commands to download the binary and add it to the system PATH.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_40

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
New-Item -Path 'c:\' -Name 'minikube' -ItemType Directory -Force
Invoke-WebRequest -OutFile 'c:\minikube\minikube.exe' -Uri 'https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/releases/latest/download/minikube-windows-amd64.exe' -UseBasicParsing
```

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
$oldPath = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('Path', [EnvironmentVariableTarget]::Machine)
if ($oldPath.Split(';') -inotcontains 'C:\minikube'){
  [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('Path', $('{0};C:\minikube' -f $oldPath), [EnvironmentVariableTarget]::Machine)
}
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Minikube on macOS ARM64 using Homebrew
DESCRIPTION: Installs the latest stable version of Minikube for macOS ARM64 using the Homebrew package manager. If the installation fails, it includes steps to unlink and relink the package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_36

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
brew install minikube
```

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
brew unlink minikube
brew link minikube
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Local Kubernetes Cluster with Minikube
DESCRIPTION: Command to initialize a local Kubernetes cluster using minikube. This creates a development environment that requires either Docker (or compatible container runtime) or a Virtual Machine environment as a prerequisite.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
minikube start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Deploying Application with kubectl in Minikube
DESCRIPTION: Creates a deployment using kicbase/echo-server image and exposes it through a LoadBalancer service on port 8080.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/deploying.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
kubectl create deployment hello-minikube1 --image=kicbase/echo-server:1.0
kubectl expose deployment hello-minikube1 --type=LoadBalancer --port=8080
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Available Minikube Addons
DESCRIPTION: Displays all available addons for the current version of Minikube.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/deploying.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube addons list
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing minikube on Linux x86-64 (Stable RPM Package)
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to download and install the stable version of minikube for Linux x86-64 architecture using RPM package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -LO https://storage.googleapis.com/minikube/releases/latest/minikube-latest.x86_64.rpm
sudo rpm -Uvh minikube-latest.x86_64.rpm
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Validating Minikube Service Commands
DESCRIPTION: Tests various aspects of the Minikube service command, including listing services, retrieving service URLs, and connecting to services.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/contrib/tests.en.md#2025-04-18_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
minikube service list
minikube service list -o JSON
minikube service --https --url
minikube service --url --format={{.IP}}
minikube service --url
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting Up Port Forwarding for Minikube Registry on Windows
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use kubectl port-forward to map the local workstation to the Minikube VM, enabling access to the Minikube registry on Windows.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/registry.md#2025-04-18_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
kubectl port-forward --namespace kube-system service/registry 5000:80
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing minikube on Linux x86-64 (Stable Binary)
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to download and install the stable version of minikube for Linux x86-64 architecture using binary download method.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -LO https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/releases/latest/download/minikube-linux-amd64
sudo install minikube-linux-amd64 /usr/local/bin/minikube && rm minikube-linux-amd64
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing minikube on Linux ARM64 (Beta Debian Package)
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to download and install the beta version of minikube for Linux ARM64 architecture using Debian package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_11

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
r=https://api.github.com/repos/kubernetes/minikube/releases
u=$(curl -s $r | grep -o 'http.*download/v.*beta.*/minikube_.*_arm64.deb' | head -n1)
curl -L $u > minikube_beta_arm64.deb && sudo dpkg -i minikube_beta_arm64.deb
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using the minikube docker-env Command in Shell
DESCRIPTION: Basic usage of the minikube docker-env command which provides instructions to point your terminal's docker-cli to the Docker Engine inside minikube. This allows for docker operations directly on the docker inside minikube.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/docker-env.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube docker-env [flags]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Minikube on Windows x86-64 using Windows Package Manager
DESCRIPTION: Installs the latest stable version of Minikube for Windows x86-64 using the Windows Package Manager (winget). This method requires the Windows Package Manager to be installed.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_38

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
winget install Kubernetes.minikube
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Loading Images Directly to Minikube Cluster
DESCRIPTION: Command to load a local container image directly into the Minikube cluster using the minikube CLI. This talks directly to the container runtime in the cluster without requiring SSH access.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/pushing.md#2025-04-18_snippet_26

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube image load my_image
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing Kubernetes Dashboard UI in Minikube
DESCRIPTION: This command enables the dashboard add-on and opens the proxy in the default web browser. It provides access to the Kubernetes Dashboard UI for managing and monitoring cluster resources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/dashboard.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube dashboard
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting a Minikube Cluster
DESCRIPTION: Initializes a new Minikube cluster on the local machine. This command sets up a single-node Kubernetes cluster for development and testing purposes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/controls.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Testing Minikube Dry-Run Mode
DESCRIPTION: Runs Minikube in dry-run mode with insufficient memory to test error handling, and then with default settings to ensure no errors are raised.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/contrib/tests.en.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
minikube start --dry-run --memory 250MB
```

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
minikube start --dry-run
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Loading Images into Minikube
DESCRIPTION: Command syntax for loading container images into Minikube from various sources. This supports loading images by name from Docker, from a tar archive file, or from standard input.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/image.md#2025-04-18_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube image load IMAGE | ARCHIVE | - [flags]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Opening Minikube Service in Browser
DESCRIPTION: Opens the exposed 'hello-minikube' service in the default web browser. This command simplifies access to services running in the Minikube cluster.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/controls.md#2025-04-18_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube service hello-minikube
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Minikube Beta on Linux ARM64 using RPM package
DESCRIPTION: Downloads and installs the latest beta version of Minikube for Linux ARM64 using an RPM package. This method fetches the latest beta release URL from GitHub API and requires root privileges to install the package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
r=https://api.github.com/repos/kubernetes/minikube/releases
u=$(curl -s $r | grep -o 'http.*download/v.*beta.*/minikube-.*.aarch64.rpm' | head -n1)
curl -L $u > minikube-beta.aarch64.rpm && sudo rpm -Uvh minikube-beta.aarch64.rpm
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Getting Pods in Minikube
DESCRIPTION: Command to list all pods in the Minikube cluster
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/kubectl.md#2025-04-18_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube kubectl -- get pods
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pushing Docker Image to Minikube Registry
DESCRIPTION: This command pushes a Docker image to the Minikube registry, making it available for use within the cluster.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/pushing.md#2025-04-18_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker push $(minikube ip):5000/test-img
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Images with Buildkit in Minikube
DESCRIPTION: Command for building container images using Buildkit directly inside the Minikube node. Requires sudo permissions and works with the Containerd runtime.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/pushing.md#2025-04-18_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo buildctl build
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Multi-Node Minikube Cluster
DESCRIPTION: Command to initialize a 2-node Minikube cluster with Docker driver.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/tutorials/multi_node.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube start --nodes 2 -p multinode-demo
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating Deployment in Minikube
DESCRIPTION: Command to create a new deployment using an echo server image
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/kubectl.md#2025-04-18_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube kubectl -- create deployment hello-minikube --image=kicbase/echo-server:1.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Evaluating Docker Environment for Minikube (Linux/macOS)
DESCRIPTION: This command configures the current terminal to use the Docker daemon inside the Minikube cluster, allowing direct image building and access without pushing to a registry.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/pushing.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
eval $(minikube docker-env)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Local Kubernetes Cluster with Minikube in Shell
DESCRIPTION: This command initiates a local Kubernetes cluster using Minikube. It allows for optional flags to customize the cluster configuration. The command is typically used by developers to set up a local development environment for Kubernetes-based applications.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/start.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube start [flags]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using minikube service Command
DESCRIPTION: Basic usage of the minikube service command to return a URL for connecting to a Kubernetes service in a local cluster. This command returns URL(s) for the specified service, printing multiple URLs one at a time if applicable.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/service.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube service [flags] SERVICE
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Enabling a Minikube addon
DESCRIPTION: The enable subcommand activates a specified addon with optional parameters for customization. It supports flags for forcing operations, specifying images, refreshing pods, and defining registries.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/addons.md#2025-04-18_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube addons enable ADDON_NAME [flags]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Minikube on macOS ARM64 using binary download
DESCRIPTION: Downloads and installs the latest stable version of Minikube for macOS ARM64 architecture using a binary download. This method requires root privileges to install the binary in /usr/local/bin.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_35

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -LO https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/releases/latest/download/minikube-darwin-arm64
sudo install minikube-darwin-arm64 /usr/local/bin/minikube
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Pushing Images with Minikube
DESCRIPTION: Command to push container images from the Minikube environment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/image.md#2025-04-18_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube image push [flags]
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Creating SSH Tunnel for Containerd Socket
DESCRIPTION: Command to create an SSH tunnel from the local machine to the containerd socket inside Minikube. This allows using local containerd clients to interact with the in-cluster containerd daemon.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/pushing.md#2025-04-18_snippet_20

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
ssh -nNT -L ./containerd.sock:/run/containerd/containerd.sock ... &
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Images Directly to Minikube Cluster
DESCRIPTION: Command to build a container image directly in the Minikube cluster using the minikube CLI. This builds against the same storage as the Kubernetes cluster is using and tags the image automatically.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/pushing.md#2025-04-18_snippet_27

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube image build -t my_image .
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Minikube Cluster
DESCRIPTION: Initializes and starts a local Kubernetes cluster using Minikube, creating a virtual environment for Kubernetes deployment.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/tutorials/kubernetes_101/module1.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube start
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Minikube Service Tunnel
DESCRIPTION: This command creates a tunnel to the 'hello-minikube1' service, allowing direct access from the host operating system.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/accessing.md#2025-04-18_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube service hello-minikube1 --url
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Minikube Tunnel for LoadBalancer
DESCRIPTION: This command starts the Minikube tunnel process, enabling LoadBalancer service access. It needs to be run in a separate terminal window.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/accessing.md#2025-04-18_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube tunnel
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing Images in Containerd Runtime in Minikube
DESCRIPTION: Command for importing images into the Containerd runtime directly inside the Minikube node. Requires sudo permissions and makes the images available to the Kubernetes cluster.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/pushing.md#2025-04-18_snippet_15

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
sudo ctr images import
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Starting Minikube with Static IP Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Commands to start a Minikube cluster with a static IP address using Docker driver and verify the configured IP. The example sets the static IP to 192.168.200.200 and demonstrates how to confirm the IP assignment using the minikube ip command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/tutorials/static_ip.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ minikube start --driver docker --static-ip 192.168.200.200
😄  minikube v1.28.0 on Darwin 13.1 (arm64)
✨  Using the docker driver based on user configuration
📌  Using Docker Desktop driver with root privileges
👍  Starting control plane node minikube in cluster minikube
🚜  Pulling base image ...
🔥  Creating docker container (CPUs=2, Memory=4000MB) ...
🐳  Preparing Kubernetes v1.25.3 on Docker 20.10.21 ...
    ▪ Generating certificates and keys ...
    ▪ Booting up control plane ...
    ▪ Configuring RBAC rules ...
🔎  Verifying Kubernetes components...
    ▪ Using image gcr.io/k8s-minikube/storage-provisioner:v5
🌟  Enabled addons: default-storageclass
🏄  Done! kubectl is now configured to use "minikube" cluster and "default" namespace by default

$ minikube ip
192.168.200.200
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Rolling Back Kubernetes Deployment
DESCRIPTION: Command to rollback a deployment to its previous known state.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/tutorials/kubernetes_101/module6.md#2025-04-18_snippet_8

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
kubectl rollout undo deployments/kubernetes-bootcamp
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Adding a Worker Node to Minikube Cluster
DESCRIPTION: This command adds a new worker node to an existing Minikube cluster, increasing the cluster's capacity for running workloads.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/tutorials/multi_control_plane_ha_clusters.md#2025-04-18_snippet_12

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube node add -p ha-demo
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing Kubernetes Dashboard
DESCRIPTION: Opens the Kubernetes dashboard running within the Minikube cluster. This provides a web-based UI for managing and monitoring the cluster resources.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/controls.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube dashboard
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Minikube on Linux ppc64 using Debian package
DESCRIPTION: Downloads and installs the latest stable version of Minikube for Linux ppc64le architecture using a Debian package. This method requires root privileges to install the package using dpkg.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_16

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -LO https://storage.googleapis.com/minikube/releases/latest/minikube_latest_ppc64le.deb
sudo dpkg -i minikube_latest_ppc64le.deb
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Service Inspection
DESCRIPTION: Commands to examine the created service details and set up environment variables for accessing it.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/tutorials/kubernetes_101/module4.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
kubectl describe services/kubernetes-bootcamp
export NODE_PORT=$(kubectl get services/kubernetes-bootcamp -o go-template='{{(index .spec.ports 0).nodePort}}')
echo NODE_PORT=$NODE_PORT
curl $(minikube ip):$NODE_PORT
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Validating Connectivity to Host using Minikube SSH and Ping
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use 'minikube ssh' to access the Minikube VM and then ping the host using the 'host.minikube.internal' hostname. It shows the expected output of a successful ping request.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/host-access.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
$ ping host.minikube.internal
PING host.minikube.internal (192.168.64.1): 56 data bytes
64 bytes from 192.168.64.1: seq=0 ttl=64 time=0.225 ms
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing minikube on Linux x86-64 (Beta RPM Package)
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to download and install the beta version of minikube for Linux x86-64 architecture using RPM package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
r=https://api.github.com/repos/kubernetes/minikube/releases
u=$(curl -s $r | grep -o 'http.*download/v.*beta.*/minikube-.*.x86_64.rpm' | head -n1)
curl -L $u > minikube-beta.x86_64.rpm && sudo rpm -Uvh minikube-beta.x86_64.rpm
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Basic Minikube Configuration Help Command
DESCRIPTION: Command to display all available flags for the minikube start command.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/config.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube start --help
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing and Running Minikube in CI Environment
DESCRIPTION: Script for installing the latest Minikube and kubectl binaries, configuring notifications, and starting Minikube with docker driver in a CI environment. This setup runs Minikube as a non-root user.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/tutorials/continuous_integration.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
curl -LO \
  https://storage.googleapis.com/minikube/releases/latest/minikube-linux-amd64 \
  && install minikube-linux-amd64 /tmp/
  
kv=$(curl -sSL https://dl.k8s.io/release/stable.txt)
curl -LO \
  https://dl.k8s.io/$kv/bin/linux/amd64/kubectl \
  && install kubectl /tmp/

/tmp/minikube-linux-amd64 config set WantUpdateNotification false
/tmp/minikube-linux-amd64 start --driver=docker
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Caching Docker Image in Minikube
DESCRIPTION: This command adds a Docker image to Minikube's cache, making it available for all future Minikube clusters on the machine without needing to pull from a remote registry.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/pushing.md#2025-04-18_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube cache add alpine:latest
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Fetching NodePort URL in Minikube

TITLE: Minikube Command-Line Options Reference
DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive list of command-line flags available for the Minikube start command. These options allow for granular configuration of a local Kubernetes cluster including CPU/memory allocation, container runtime selection, networking options, and driver-specific settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/start.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
      --addons minikube addons list       Enable addons. see minikube addons list for a list of valid addon names.
      --apiserver-ips ipSlice             A set of apiserver IP Addresses which are used in the generated certificate for kubernetes.  This can be used if you want to make the apiserver available from outside the machine (default [])
      --apiserver-name string             The authoritative apiserver hostname for apiserver certificates and connectivity. This can be used if you want to make the apiserver available from outside the machine (default "minikubeCA")
      --apiserver-names strings           A set of apiserver names which are used in the generated certificate for kubernetes.  This can be used if you want to make the apiserver available from outside the machine
      --apiserver-port int                The apiserver listening port (default 8443)
      --auto-pause-interval duration      Duration of inactivity before the minikube VM is paused (default 1m0s) (default 1m0s)
      --auto-update-drivers               If set, automatically updates drivers to the latest version. Defaults to true. (default true)
      --base-image string                 The base image to use for docker/podman drivers. Intended for local development. (default "gcr.io/k8s-minikube/kicbase-builds:v0.0.46-1744107393-20604@sha256:2430533582a8c08f907b2d5976c79bd2e672b4f3d4484088c99b839f3175ed6a")
      --binary-mirror string              Location to fetch kubectl, kubelet, & kubeadm binaries from.
      --cache-images                      If true, cache docker images for the current bootstrapper and load them into the machine. Always false with --driver=none. (default true)
      --cert-expiration duration          Duration until minikube certificate expiration, defaults to three years (26280h). (default 26280h0m0s)
      --cni string                        CNI plug-in to use. Valid options: auto, bridge, calico, cilium, flannel, kindnet, or path to a CNI manifest (default: auto)
  -c, --container-runtime string          The container runtime to be used. Valid options: docker, cri-o, containerd (default: auto)
      --cpus string                       Number of CPUs allocated to Kubernetes. Use "max" to use the maximum number of CPUs. Use "no-limit" to not specify a limit (Docker/Podman only) (default "2")
      --cri-socket string                 The cri socket path to be used.
      --delete-on-failure                 If set, delete the current cluster if start fails and try again. Defaults to false.
      --disable-driver-mounts             Disables the filesystem mounts provided by the hypervisors
      --disable-metrics                   If set, disables metrics reporting (CPU and memory usage), this can improve CPU usage. Defaults to false.
      --disable-optimizations             If set, disables optimizations that are set for local Kubernetes. Including decreasing CoreDNS replicas from 2 to 1. Defaults to false.
      --disk-size string                  Disk size allocated to the minikube VM (format: <number>[<unit>], where unit = b, k, m or g). (default "20000mb")
      --dns-domain string                 The cluster dns domain name used in the Kubernetes cluster (default "cluster.local")
      --dns-proxy                         Enable proxy for NAT DNS requests (virtualbox driver only)
      --docker-env stringArray            Environment variables to pass to the Docker daemon. (format: key=value)
      --docker-opt stringArray            Specify arbitrary flags to pass to the Docker daemon. (format: key=value)
      --download-only                     If true, only download and cache files for later use - don't install or start anything.
  -d, --driver string                     Used to specify the driver to run Kubernetes in. The list of available drivers depends on operating system.
      --dry-run                           dry-run mode. Validates configuration, but does not mutate system state
      --embed-certs                       if true, will embed the certs in kubeconfig.
      --enable-default-cni                DEPRECATED: Replaced by --cni=bridge
      --extra-config ExtraOption          A set of key=value pairs that describe configuration that may be passed to different components.
                                          		The key should be '.' separated, and the first part before the dot is the component to apply the configuration to.
                                          		Valid components are: kubelet, kubeadm, apiserver, controller-manager, etcd, proxy, scheduler
                                          		Valid kubeadm parameters: ignore-preflight-errors, dry-run, kubeconfig, kubeconfig-dir, node-name, cri-socket, experimental-upload-certs, certificate-key, rootfs, skip-phases, pod-network-cidr
      --extra-disks int                   Number of extra disks created and attached to the minikube VM (currently only implemented for hyperkit, kvm2, and qemu2 drivers)
      --feature-gates string              A set of key=value pairs that describe feature gates for alpha/experimental features.
      --force                             Force minikube to perform possibly dangerous operations
      --force-systemd                     If set, force the container runtime to use systemd as cgroup manager. Defaults to false.
  -g, --gpus string                       Allow pods to use your GPUs. Options include: [all,nvidia,amd] (Docker driver with Docker container-runtime only)
      --ha                                Create Highly Available Multi-Control Plane Cluster with a minimum of three control-plane nodes that will also be marked for work.
      --host-dns-resolver                 Enable host resolver for NAT DNS requests (virtualbox driver only) (default true)
      --host-only-cidr string             The CIDR to be used for the minikube VM (virtualbox driver only) (default "192.168.59.1/24")
      --host-only-nic-type string         NIC Type used for host only network. One of Am79C970A, Am79C973, 82540EM, 82543GC, 82545EM, or virtio (virtualbox driver only) (default "virtio")
      --hyperkit-vpnkit-sock string       Location of the VPNKit socket used for networking. If empty, disables Hyperkit VPNKitSock, if 'auto' uses Docker for Mac VPNKit connection, otherwise uses the specified VSock (hyperkit driver only)
      --hyperkit-vsock-ports strings      List of guest VSock ports that should be exposed as sockets on the host (hyperkit driver only)
      --hyperv-external-adapter string    External Adapter on which external switch will be created if no external switch is found. (hyperv driver only)
      --hyperv-use-external-switch        Whether to use external switch over Default Switch if virtual switch not explicitly specified. (hyperv driver only)
      --hyperv-virtual-switch string      The hyperv virtual switch name. Defaults to first found. (hyperv driver only)
      --image-mirror-country string       Country code of the image mirror to be used. Leave empty to use the global one. For Chinese mainland users, set it to cn.
      --image-repository string           Alternative image repository to pull docker images from. This can be used when you have limited access to gcr.io. Set it to "auto" to let minikube decide one for you. For Chinese mainland users, you may use local gcr.io mirrors such as registry.cn-hangzhou.aliyuncs.com/google_containers
      --insecure-registry strings         Insecure Docker registries to pass to the Docker daemon.  The default service CIDR range will automatically be added.
      --install-addons                    If set, install addons. Defaults to true. (default true)
      --interactive                       Allow user prompts for more information (default true)
      --iso-url strings                   Locations to fetch the minikube ISO from. The list depends on the machine architecture.
      --keep-context                      This will keep the existing kubectl context and will create a minikube context.
      --kubernetes-version string         The Kubernetes version that the minikube VM will use (ex: v1.2.3, 'stable' for v1.32.2, 'latest' for v1.32.2). Defaults to 'stable'.
      --kvm-gpu                           Enable experimental NVIDIA GPU support in minikube
      --kvm-hidden                        Hide the hypervisor signature from the guest in minikube (kvm2 driver only)
      --kvm-network string                The KVM default network name. (kvm2 driver only) (default "default")
      --kvm-numa-count int                Simulate numa node count in minikube, supported numa node count range is 1-8 (kvm2 driver only) (default 1)
      --kvm-qemu-uri string               The KVM QEMU connection URI. (kvm2 driver only) (default "qemu:///system")
      --listen-address string             IP Address to use to expose ports (docker and podman driver only)
      --memory string                     Amount of RAM to allocate to Kubernetes (format: <number>[<unit>], where unit = b, k, m or g). Use "max" to use the maximum amount of memory. Use "no-limit" to not specify a limit (Docker/Podman only)
      --mount                             This will start the mount daemon and automatically mount files into minikube.
      --mount-9p-version string           Specify the 9p version that the mount should use (default "9p2000.L")
      --mount-gid string                  Default group id used for the mount (default "docker")
      --mount-ip string                   Specify the ip that the mount should be setup on
      --mount-msize int                   The number of bytes to use for 9p packet payload (default 262144)
      --mount-options strings             Additional mount options, such as cache=fscache
      --mount-port uint16                 Specify the port that the mount should be setup on, where 0 means any free port.
```

TITLE: Installing Minikube Beta on Windows x86-64 using .exe download
DESCRIPTION: Downloads and installs the latest beta version of Minikube for Windows x86-64 using an executable installer. It provides PowerShell commands to fetch the latest beta release URL from GitHub API and download the binary.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_41

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
New-Item -Path 'c:\' -Name 'minikube' -ItemType Directory -Force
$response = Invoke-WebRequest -Uri 'https://api.github.com/repos/kubernetes/minikube/releases' -UseBasicParsing
$json = $response.Content | ConvertFrom-Json
$item = ($json | ?{ $_.prerelease -eq $true })[0].assets | ?{ $_.name -eq 'minikube-windows-amd64.exe' }
```

TITLE: Hello World Deployment Configuration
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for deploying a hello-world application with pod anti-affinity to ensure distribution across nodes.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/tutorials/multi_node.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: hello
spec:
  replicas: 2
  strategy:
    type: RollingUpdate
    rollingUpdate:
      maxUnavailable: 100%
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: hello
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: hello
    spec:
      affinity:
        podAntiAffinity:
          requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
            - labelSelector:
                matchExpressions: [{ key: app, operator: In, values: [hello] }]
              topologyKey: "kubernetes.io/hostname"
      containers:
        - name: hello-from
          image: pbitty/hello-from:latest
          ports:
            - name: http
              containerPort: 80
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 1
```

TITLE: Configuring PersistentVolume in Minikube (YAML)
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet demonstrates how to configure a PersistentVolume in Minikube to persist data in the '/data' directory. It specifies the API version, kind, metadata, and spec for the PersistentVolume, including access modes, capacity, and hostPath.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/persistent_volumes.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
apiVersion: v1
kind: PersistentVolume
metadata:
  name: pv0001
spec:
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  capacity:
    storage: 5Gi
  hostPath:
    path: /data/pv0001/
```

TITLE: minikube logs Command Options
DESCRIPTION: Available flags for the minikube logs command to control log output. These options allow filtering logs by type, redirecting output to a file, following logs in real-time, and limiting the log length.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/logs.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
      --audit             Show only the audit logs
      --file string       If present, writes to the provided file instead of stdout.
  -f, --follow            Show only the most recent journal entries, and continuously print new entries as they are appended to the journal.
      --last-start-only   Show only the last start logs.
  -n, --length int        Number of lines back to go within the log (default 60)
      --node string       The node to get logs from. Defaults to the primary control plane.
      --problems          Show only log entries which point to known problems
```

TITLE: Minikube Status Command Options
DESCRIPTION: Available command-line options for the minikube status command, including format customization, layout selection, node specification, output format options, and continuous status monitoring capabilities.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/status.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
  -f, --format string         Go template format string for the status output.  The format for Go templates can be found here: https://pkg.go.dev/text/template
                              For the list accessible variables for the template, see the struct values here: https://pkg.go.dev/k8s.io/minikube/cmd/minikube/cmd#Status (default "{{.Name}}\ntype: Control Plane\nhost: {{.Host}}\nkubelet: {{.Kubelet}}\napiserver: {{.APIServer}}\nkubeconfig: {{.Kubeconfig}}\n{{- if .TimeToStop }}\ntimeToStop: {{.TimeToStop}}\n{{- end }}\n{{- if .DockerEnv }}\ndocker-env: {{.DockerEnv}}\n{{- end }}\n{{- if .PodManEnv }}\npodman-env: {{.PodManEnv}}\n{{- end }}\n\n")
  -l, --layout string         output layout (EXPERIMENTAL, JSON only): 'nodes' or 'cluster' (default "nodes")
  -n, --node string           The node to check status for. Defaults to control plane. Leave blank with default format for status on all nodes.
  -o, --output string         minikube status --output OUTPUT. json, text (default "text")
  -w, --watch duration[=1s]   Continuously listing/getting the status with optional interval duration. (default 1s)
```

TITLE: Deploying a Hello Service in Kubernetes
DESCRIPTION: This multi-part command creates a Kubernetes deployment and service for a 'hello' application that returns the IP address of the serving pod. It includes pod anti-affinity rules for high availability.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/tutorials/multi_control_plane_ha_clusters.md#2025-04-18_snippet_13

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
kubectl apply -f - <<EOF
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: hello
spec:
  replicas: 3
  strategy:
    type: RollingUpdate
    rollingUpdate:
      maxUnavailable: 100%
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: hello
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: hello
    spec:
      affinity:
        # ⬇⬇⬇ This ensures pods will land on separate hosts
        podAntiAffinity:
          requiredDuringSchedulingIgnoredDuringExecution:
            - labelSelector:
                matchExpressions: [{ key: app, operator: In, values: [hello] }]
              topologyKey: "kubernetes.io/hostname"
      containers:
        - name: hello-from
          image: pbitty/hello-from:latest
          ports:
            - name: http
              containerPort: 80
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 1
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  name: hello
spec:
  type: NodePort
  selector:
    app: hello
  ports:
    - protocol: TCP
      nodePort: 31000
      port: 80
      targetPort: http
EOF
```

TITLE: Configuring and Starting Minikube with Audit Policy
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to create an audit policy file, configure Minikube to use it, and start Minikube with the appropriate settings. It also includes a command to verify that the audit policy is being applied.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/tutorials/audit-policy.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
minikube stop

mkdir -p ~/.minikube/files/etc/ssl/certs

cat <<EOF > ~/.minikube/files/etc/ssl/certs/audit-policy.yaml
# Log all requests at the Metadata level.
apiVersion: audit.k8s.io/v1
kind: Policy
rules:
- level: Metadata
EOF

minikube start \
  --extra-config=apiserver.audit-policy-file=/etc/ssl/certs/audit-policy.yaml \
  --extra-config=apiserver.audit-log-path=-

kubectl logs kube-apiserver-minikube -n kube-system | grep audit.k8s.io/v1
```

TITLE: Fetching GitHub Releases for minikube using JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This script fetches the latest releases of minikube from GitHub API, checks if the most recent release is a beta, and updates the UI accordingly by showing or hiding beta installation options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
const architectures = [
  "Linux/x86-64",
  "Linux/ARM64",
  "Linux/ppc64",
  "Linux/S390x",
  "Linux/ARMv7",
  "macOS/x86-64",
  "macOS/ARM64",
  "Windows/x86-64"
];

console.time("timerReleaseFetch");
fetch('https://api.github.com/repos/kubernetes/minikube/releases')
  .then((response) => response.json())
  .then((releases) => {
    console.timeEnd("timerReleaseFetch");
    if (releases && releases.length > 0 && releases[0] && releases[0].tag_name) {
      const isBetaMostRecent = releases[0].tag_name.includes("-beta");

      if (isBetaMostRecent) {
        for (architecture of architectures) {
          const betaElement = document.querySelector(`button[data-quiz-id="/${architecture}/Beta"]`);
          if (betaElement) {
            betaElement.classList.remove("hide");
          }
        }
      }
    }
  })
  .catch(console.error);
```

TITLE: Configuring BuildKit Socket Permissions in Minikube
DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to make the BuildKit socket accessible to regular users in Minikube. Creates a buildkit group, changes socket ownership, and adds the current user to the group.

TITLE: Configuring Linux DNS Resolution with systemd-resolved
DESCRIPTION: Commands to configure DNS resolution on Linux systems using systemd-resolved. This creates a configuration file for Minikube DNS and restarts the systemd-resolved service.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/addons/ingress-dns.md#2025-04-18_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
sudo mkdir -p /etc/systemd/resolved.conf.d
sudo tee /etc/systemd/resolved.conf.d/minikube.conf << EOF

DNS=$(minikube ip)
Domains=~test
EOF
sudo systemctl restart systemd-resolved
```

TITLE: Minikube Parent Command Options
DESCRIPTION: Inherited options from parent commands that can be used with the minikube status command, including logging configuration, profile selection, and various other global settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/status.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
      --add_dir_header                   If true, adds the file directory to the header of the log messages
      --alsologtostderr                  log to standard error as well as files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
  -b, --bootstrapper string              The name of the cluster bootstrapper that will set up the Kubernetes cluster. (default "kubeadm")
  -h, --help                             
      --log_backtrace_at traceLocation   when logging hits line file:N, emit a stack trace (default :0)
      --log_dir string                   If non-empty, write log files in this directory (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file string                  If non-empty, use this log file (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file_max_size uint           Defines the maximum size a log file can grow to (no effect when -logtostderr=true). Unit is megabytes. If the value is 0, the maximum file size is unlimited. (default 1800)
      --logtostderr                      log to standard error instead of files
      --one_output                       If true, only write logs to their native severity level (vs also writing to each lower severity level; no effect when -logtostderr=true)
  -p, --profile string                   The name of the minikube VM being used. This can be set to allow having multiple instances of minikube independently. (default "minikube")
      --rootless                         Force to use rootless driver (docker and podman driver only)
      --skip-audit                       Skip recording the current command in the audit logs.
      --skip_headers                     If true, avoid header prefixes in the log messages
      --skip_log_headers                 If true, avoid headers when opening log files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --stderrthreshold severity         logs at or above this threshold go to stderr when writing to files and stderr (no effect when -logtostderr=true or -alsologtostderr=true) (default 2)
      --user string                      Specifies the user executing the operation. Useful for auditing operations executed by 3rd party tools. Defaults to the operating system username.
  -v, --v Level                          number for the log level verbosity
      --vmodule moduleSpec               comma-separated list of pattern=N settings for file-filtered logging
```

TITLE: Configuring Minikube Image Build in YAML
DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration specifies the base image, build arguments, and labels for building Minikube images. It sets the base image to 'gcr.io/k8s-minikube/kicbase' and includes various build arguments and labels related to version information and build details.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/test/integration/testdata/build/content.txt#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
# Copyright 2018 The Kubernetes Authors All rights reserved.
#
# Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License");
# you may not use this file except in compliance with the License.
# You may obtain a copy of the License at
#
#     http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
#
# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software
# distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS,
# WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied.
# See the License for the specific language governing permissions and
# limitations under the License.

base_image: gcr.io/k8s-minikube/kicbase
build_args:
  COMMIT_SHA: ${COMMIT_SHA}
  STABLE_DOCKER_TAG: ${STABLE_DOCKER_TAG}
  MINIKUBE_VERSION: ${MINIKUBE_INTEGRATION_VERSION}
  BUILD_ID: ${BUILD_ID}
  MINIKUBE_HEAD_COMMIT: ${MINIKUBE_HEAD_COMMIT}
labels:
  org.opencontainers.image.revision: ${COMMIT_SHA}
  org.opencontainers.image.created: ${BUILD_DATE}
  org.opencontainers.image.version: ${VERSION}
  org.opencontainers.image.title: "Minikube"
  org.opencontainers.image.description: "Minikube - a tool that makes it easy to run Kubernetes locally"
  org.opencontainers.image.url: "https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/"
  org.opencontainers.image.source: "https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube"
  org.opencontainers.image.licenses: "Apache-2.0"
  org.opencontainers.image.authors: "Kubernetes"
```

TITLE: Mount-Specific Options for minikube mount

CODE:

```
      --9p-version string   Specify the 9p version that the mount should use (default "9p2000.L")
      --gid string          Default group id used for the mount (default "docker")
      --ip string           Specify the ip that the mount should be setup on
      --kill                Kill the mount process spawned by minikube start
      --msize int           The number of bytes to use for 9p packet payload (default 262144)
      --options strings     Additional mount options, such as cache=fscache
      --port uint16         Specify the port that the mount should be setup on, where 0 means any free port.
      --type string         Specify the mount filesystem type (supported types: 9p) (default "9p")
      --uid string          Default user id used for the mount (default "docker")
```

TITLE: Setting Proxy Environment Variables for Minikube on macOS/Linux
DESCRIPTION: Example of setting HTTP_PROXY, HTTPS_PROXY, and NO_PROXY environment variables for Minikube on macOS and Linux systems. These settings allow Minikube to access the internet through a proxy while excluding local and cluster IP ranges.

```
minikube start
```

TITLE: Inherited Options for minikube Commands in Shell
DESCRIPTION: These are the options inherited from parent commands that can be used with the 'minikube update-check' command. They include various logging configurations, profile settings, and other customization options.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/update-check.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
      --add_dir_header                   If true, adds the file directory to the header of the log messages
      --alsologtostderr                  log to standard error as well as files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
  -b, --bootstrapper string              The name of the cluster bootstrapper that will set up the Kubernetes cluster. (default "kubeadm")
  -h, --help                             
      --log_backtrace_at traceLocation   when logging hits line file:N, emit a stack trace (default :0)
      --log_dir string                   If non-empty, write log files in this directory (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file string                  If non-empty, use this log file (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file_max_size uint           Defines the maximum size a log file can grow to (no effect when -logtostderr=true). Unit is megabytes. If the value is 0, the maximum file size is unlimited. (default 1800)
      --logtostderr                      log to standard error instead of files
      --one_output                       If true, only write logs to their native severity level (vs also writing to each lower severity level; no effect when -logtostderr=true)
  -p, --profile string                   The name of the minikube VM being used. This can be set to allow having multiple instances of minikube independently. (default "minikube")
      --rootless                         Force to use rootless driver (docker and podman driver only)
      --skip-audit                       Skip recording the current command in the audit logs.
      --skip_headers                     If true, avoid header prefixes in the log messages
      --skip_log_headers                 If true, avoid headers when opening log files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --stderrthreshold severity         logs at or above this threshold go to stderr when writing to files and stderr (no effect when -logtostderr=true or -alsologtostderr=true) (default 2)
      --user string                      Specifies the user executing the operation. Useful for auditing operations executed by 3rd party tools. Defaults to the operating system username.
  -v, --v Level                          number for the log level verbosity
      --vmodule moduleSpec               comma-separated list of pattern=N settings for file-filtered logging
```

TITLE: Configuring Port Forwarding for Minikube Registry on macOS

SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/registry.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell


TITLE: Creating PVC and Pod for Local Path Provisioner Testing
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration to create a PersistentVolumeClaim and a Pod that writes to a file on the second Minikube node using Local Path Provisioner.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/tutorials/local_path_provisioner.md#2025-04-18_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: PersistentVolumeClaim
metadata:
  name: test-pvc
spec:
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteOnce
  resources:
    requests:
      storage: 64Mi
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: test-local-path
spec:
  restartPolicy: OnFailure
  nodeSelector:
    "kubernetes.io/hostname": "minikube-m02"
  containers:
    - name: busybox
      image: busybox:stable
      command: ["sh", "-c", "echo 'local-path-provisioner' > /test/file1"]
      volumeMounts:
      - name: data
        mountPath: /test
  volumes:
    - name: data
      persistentVolumeClaim:
        claimName: test-pvc
```

TITLE: Adding Minikube to Windows PATH Environment Variable
DESCRIPTION: PowerShell script that adds the Minikube directory to the system PATH environment variable, only if it doesn't already exist in the path. Requires administrator privileges to execute.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_43

LANGUAGE: powershell
CODE:
```
$oldPath = [Environment]::GetEnvironmentVariable('Path', [EnvironmentVariableTarget]::Machine)
if ($oldPath.Split(';') -inotcontains 'C:\minikube'){
  [Environment]::SetEnvironmentVariable('Path', $('{0};C:\minikube' -f $oldPath), [EnvironmentVariableTarget]::Machine)
}
```

TITLE: Parent command options inherited by the tunnel command
DESCRIPTION: Global minikube options that can be used with the tunnel command, including logging configuration, profile selection, and various system settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/tunnel.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
      --add_dir_header                   If true, adds the file directory to the header of the log messages
      --alsologtostderr                  log to standard error as well as files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
  -b, --bootstrapper string              The name of the cluster bootstrapper that will set up the Kubernetes cluster. (default "kubeadm")
  -h, --help                             
      --log_backtrace_at traceLocation   when logging hits line file:N, emit a stack trace (default :0)
      --log_dir string                   If non-empty, write log files in this directory (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file string                  If non-empty, use this log file (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file_max_size uint           Defines the maximum size a log file can grow to (no effect when -logtostderr=true). Unit is megabytes. If the value is 0, the maximum file size is unlimited. (default 1800)
      --logtostderr                      log to standard error instead of files
      --one_output                       If true, only write logs to their native severity level (vs also writing to each lower severity level; no effect when -logtostderr=true)
  -p, --profile string                   The name of the minikube VM being used. This can be set to allow having multiple instances of minikube independently. (default "minikube")
      --rootless                         Force to use rootless driver (docker and podman driver only)
      --skip-audit                       Skip recording the current command in the audit logs.
      --skip_headers                     If true, avoid header prefixes in the log messages
      --skip_log_headers                 If true, avoid headers when opening log files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --stderrthreshold severity         logs at or above this threshold go to stderr when writing to files and stderr (no effect when -logtostderr=true or -alsologtostderr=true) (default 2)
      --user string                      Specifies the user executing the operation. Useful for auditing operations executed by 3rd party tools. Defaults to the operating system username.
  -v, --v Level                          number for the log level verbosity
      --vmodule moduleSpec               comma-separated list of pattern=N settings for file-filtered logging
```

TITLE: Setting up SSH Access for Root in Minikube
DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to set up SSH access for the root user in Minikube, which is required for accessing containerd directly. Creates the necessary directories and copies SSH keys with appropriate permissions.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/pushing.md#2025-04-18_snippet_18

LANGUAGE: console
CODE:
```
docker@minikube:~$ sudo mkdir /root/.ssh
docker@minikube:~$ sudo chmod 700 /root/.ssh
docker@minikube:~$ sudo cp .ssh/authorized_keys /root/.ssh/authorized_keys
docker@minikube:~$ sudo chmod 600 /root/.ssh
```

TITLE: Kubernetes Deployment with GCP Auth Skip Label
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for a Kubernetes Deployment that skips GCP credential injection using a label.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/addons/gcp-auth.md#2025-04-18_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: pytest
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: pytest
  replicas: 2
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: pytest
        gcp-auth-skip-secret: "true"
    spec:
      containers:
      - name: py-test
        imagePullPolicy: Never
        image: local-pytest
        ports:
          - containerPort: 80
```

```
  -b, --bootstrapper string              The name of the cluster bootstrapper that will set up the Kubernetes cluster. (default "kubeadm")
  -h, --help                             
      --log_backtrace_at traceLocation   when logging hits line file:N, emit a stack trace (default :0)
      --log_dir string                   If non-empty, write log files in this directory (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file string                  If non-empty, use this log file (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file_max_size uint           Defines the maximum size a log file can grow to (no effect when -logtostderr=true). Unit is megabytes. If the value is 0, the maximum file size is unlimited. (default 1800)
      --logtostderr                      log to standard error instead of files
      --one_output                       If true, only write logs to their native severity level (vs also writing to each lower severity level; no effect when -logtostderr=true)
  -p, --profile string                   The name of the minikube VM being used. This can be set to allow having multiple instances of minikube independently. (default "minikube")
      --rootless                         Force to use rootless driver (docker and podman driver only)
      --skip-audit                       Skip recording the current command in the audit logs.
      --skip_headers                     If true, avoid header prefixes in the log messages
      --skip_log_headers                 If true, avoid headers when opening log files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --stderrthreshold severity         logs at or above this threshold go to stderr when writing to files and stderr (no effect when -logtostderr=true or -alsologtostderr=true) (default 2)
      --user string                      Specifies the user executing the operation. Useful for auditing operations executed by 3rd party tools. Defaults to the operating system username.
  -v, --v Level                          number for the log level verbosity
      --vmodule moduleSpec               comma-separated list of pattern=N settings for file-filtered logging
```

TITLE: Installing Minikube Beta on Linux S390x using RPM package
DESCRIPTION: Downloads and installs the latest beta version of Minikube for Linux S390x architecture using an RPM package. This method fetches the latest beta release URL from GitHub API and requires root privileges to install the package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_25

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
r=https://api.github.com/repos/kubernetes/minikube/releases
u=$(curl -s $r | grep -o 'http.*download/v.*beta.*/minikube-.*.s390x.rpm' | head -n1)
curl -L $u > minikube-beta.s390x.rpm && sudo rpm -Uvh minikube-beta.s390x.rpm
```

TITLE: Implementing Global Default Deny Policy in Calico
DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet shows a Calico GlobalNetworkPolicy that denies all ingress and egress traffic for all pods except those in the kube-system namespace. It demonstrates Calico's extended capabilities over standard Kubernetes NetworkPolicies.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/network_policy.md#2025-04-18_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
---
apiVersion: projectcalico.org/v3
kind: GlobalNetworkPolicy
metadata:
  name: default-deny
spec:
  selector: projectcalico.org/namespace != "kube-system"
  types:
  - Ingress
  - Egress
```

TITLE: Deploying Sample Web Application with Gluster Storage
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for creating a PVC, a developer pod to generate content, and an NGINX pod to serve the website using Gluster storage.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/deploy/addons/storage-provisioner-gluster/README.md#2025-04-18_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
---
kind: PersistentVolumeClaim
apiVersion: v1
metadata:
  name: website
spec:
  accessModes:
    - ReadWriteMany
  resources:
    requests:
      storage: 2Mi
  storageClassName: glusterfile
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: centos-webdev
spec:
  containers:
  - image: centos:latest
    name: centos
    args:
    - curl
    - -o/mnt/index.html
    - https://api.ef.gy/fortune
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /mnt
      name: website
  restartPolicy: Never
  volumes:
  - name: website
    persistentVolumeClaim:
      claimName: website
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Pod
metadata:
  name: website-nginx
spec:
  containers:
  - image: gcr.io/google_containers/nginx-slim:0.8
    name: nginx
    ports:
    - containerPort: 80
      name: web
    volumeMounts:
    - mountPath: /usr/share/nginx/html
      name: website
  volumes:
  - name: website
    persistentVolumeClaim:
      claimName: website
```

TITLE: Installing CNI Plugins


TITLE: Creating Kong Ingress Rule
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration to create an Ingress rule for routing /echo requests to the echo server.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/addons/kong-ingress.md#2025-04-18_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
echo "
apiVersion: networking.k8s.io/v1
kind: Ingress
metadata:
  name: echo
  annotations:
    konghq.com/strip-path: 'true'
spec:
  ingressClassName: kong
  rules:
  - host: kong.example
    http:
      paths:
      - path: /echo
        pathType: ImplementationSpecific
        backend:
          service:
            name: echo
            port:
              number: 1027
" | kubectl apply -f -
```

TITLE: Deploying Echo Server Application
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration to deploy an echo server application that returns Pod information.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/addons/kong-ingress.md#2025-04-18_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
echo "
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  labels:
    app: echo
  name: echo
spec:
  ports:
  - port: 1025
    name: tcp
    protocol: TCP
    targetPort: 1025
  - port: 1026
    name: udp
    protocol: TCP
    targetPort: 1026
  - port: 1027
    name: http
    protocol: TCP
    targetPort: 1027
  selector:
    app: echo
---
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  labels:
    app: echo
  name: echo
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: echo
  strategy: {}
  template:
    metadata:
      creationTimestamp: null
      labels:
        app: echo
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: kong/go-echo:latest
        name: echo
        ports:
        - containerPort: 1027
        env:
          - name: NODE_NAME
            valueFrom:
              fieldRef:
                fieldPath: spec.nodeName
          - name: POD_NAME
            valueFrom:
              fieldRef:
                fieldPath: metadata.name
          - name: POD_NAMESPACE
            valueFrom:
              fieldRef:
                fieldPath: metadata.namespace
          - name: POD_IP
            valueFrom:
              fieldRef:
                fieldPath: status.podIP
        resources: {}
" | kubectl apply -f -
```

TITLE: Minikube IP Command Inherited Options in Shell
DESCRIPTION: These are the options inherited from parent commands that can be used with the 'minikube ip' command. They include various logging controls, profile selection, and other global options for Minikube.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/ip.md#2025-04-18_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
      --add_dir_header                   If true, adds the file directory to the header of the log messages
      --alsologtostderr                  log to standard error as well as files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
  -b, --bootstrapper string              The name of the cluster bootstrapper that will set up the Kubernetes cluster. (default "kubeadm")
  -h, --help                             
      --log_backtrace_at traceLocation   when logging hits line file:N, emit a stack trace (default :0)
      --log_dir string                   If non-empty, write log files in this directory (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file string                  If non-empty, use this log file (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file_max_size uint           Defines the maximum size a log file can grow to (no effect when -logtostderr=true). Unit is megabytes. If the value is 0, the maximum file size is unlimited. (default 1800)
      --logtostderr                      log to standard error instead of files
      --one_output                       If true, only write logs to their native severity level (vs also writing to each lower severity level; no effect when -logtostderr=true)
  -p, --profile string                   The name of the minikube VM being used. This can be set to allow having multiple instances of minikube independently. (default "minikube")
      --rootless                         Force to use rootless driver (docker and podman driver only)
      --skip-audit                       Skip recording the current command in the audit logs.
      --skip_headers                     If true, avoid header prefixes in the log messages
      --skip_log_headers                 If true, avoid headers when opening log files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --stderrthreshold severity         logs at or above this threshold go to stderr when writing to files and stderr (no effect when -logtostderr=true or -alsologtostderr=true) (default 2)
      --user string                      Specifies the user executing the operation. Useful for auditing operations executed by 3rd party tools. Defaults to the operating system username.
  -v, --v Level                          number for the log level verbosity
      --vmodule moduleSpec               comma-separated list of pattern=N settings for file-filtered logging
```

TITLE: Installing minikube on Linux x86-64 (Beta Debian Package)
DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to download and install the beta version of minikube for Linux x86-64 architecture using Debian package.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/start/_index.md#2025-04-18_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
r=https://api.github.com/repos/kubernetes/minikube/releases
u=$(curl -s $r | grep -o 'http.*download/v.*beta.*/minikube_.*_amd64.deb' | head -n1)
curl -L $u > minikube_beta_amd64.deb && sudo dpkg -i minikube_beta_amd64.deb
```

TITLE: CoreDNS Configuration
DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration showing the CoreDNS ConfigMap with registry aliases
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/handbook/addons/registry-aliases.md#2025-04-18_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
apiVersion: v1
data:
  Corefile: |-
    .:53 {
        errors
        health
        rewrite name example.com registry.kube-system.svc.cluster.local
        rewrite name example.org registry.kube-system.svc.cluster.local
        rewrite name test.com registry.kube-system.svc.cluster.local
        rewrite name test.org registry.kube-system.svc.cluster.local
        kubernetes cluster.local in-addr.arpa ip6.arpa {
           pods insecure
           upstream
           fallthrough in-addr.arpa ip6.arpa
        }
        prometheus :9153
        proxy . /etc/resolv.conf
        cache 30
        loop
        reload
        loadbalance
    }
kind: ConfigMap
metadata:
  name: coredns
```

TITLE: Listing Global Options for Minikube Image Commands
DESCRIPTION: Lists all global command line options that can be inherited by the 'minikube image' subcommands. These options control logging, bootstrapper selection, profile configuration, and other global Minikube settings.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/image.md#2025-04-18_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
      --add_dir_header                   If true, adds the file directory to the header of the log messages
      --alsologtostderr                  log to standard error as well as files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
  -b, --bootstrapper string              The name of the cluster bootstrapper that will set up the Kubernetes cluster. (default "kubeadm")
  -h, --help                             
      --log_backtrace_at traceLocation   when logging hits line file:N, emit a stack trace (default :0)
      --log_dir string                   If non-empty, write log files in this directory (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file string                  If non-empty, use this log file (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file_max_size uint           Defines the maximum size a log file can grow to (no effect when -logtostderr=true). Unit is megabytes. If the value is 0, the maximum file size is unlimited. (default 1800)
      --logtostderr                      log to standard error instead of files
      --one_output                       If true, only write logs to their native severity level (vs also writing to each lower severity level; no effect when -logtostderr=true)
  -p, --profile string                   The name of the minikube VM being used. This can be set to allow having multiple instances of minikube independently. (default "minikube")
      --rootless                         Force to use rootless driver (docker and podman driver only)
      --skip-audit                       Skip recording the current command in the audit logs.
      --skip_headers                     If true, avoid header prefixes in the log messages
      --skip_log_headers                 If true, avoid headers when opening log files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --stderrthreshold severity         logs at or above this threshold go to stderr when writing to files and stderr (no effect when -logtostderr=true or -alsologtostderr=true) (default 2)
      --user string                      Specifies the user executing the operation. Useful for auditing operations executed by 3rd party tools. Defaults to the operating system username.
  -v, --v Level                          number for the log level verbosity
      --vmodule moduleSpec               comma-separated list of pattern=N settings for file-filtered logging
```

TITLE: Configuring Minikube CLI Options in Bash
DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive list of command line options inherited from parent commands in Minikube. Includes options for log management, bootstrapper configuration, profile management, security settings, and verbosity controls. These options can be used with any Minikube command to customize its behavior.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/commands/config.md#2025-04-18_snippet_9

LANGUAGE: bash
CODE:
```
      --add_dir_header                   If true, adds the file directory to the header of the log messages
      --alsologtostderr                  log to standard error as well as files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
  -b, --bootstrapper string              The name of the cluster bootstrapper that will set up the Kubernetes cluster. (default "kubeadm")
  -h, --help                             
      --log_backtrace_at traceLocation   when logging hits line file:N, emit a stack trace (default :0)
      --log_dir string                   If non-empty, write log files in this directory (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file string                  If non-empty, use this log file (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --log_file_max_size uint           Defines the maximum size a log file can grow to (no effect when -logtostderr=true). Unit is megabytes. If the value is 0, the maximum file size is unlimited. (default 1800)
      --logtostderr                      log to standard error instead of files
      --one_output                       If true, only write logs to their native severity level (vs also writing to each lower severity level; no effect when -logtostderr=true)
  -p, --profile string                   The name of the minikube VM being used. This can be set to allow having multiple instances of minikube independently. (default "minikube")
      --rootless                         Force to use rootless driver (docker and podman driver only)
      --skip-audit                       Skip recording the current command in the audit logs.
      --skip_headers                     If true, avoid header prefixes in the log messages
      --skip_log_headers                 If true, avoid headers when opening log files (no effect when -logtostderr=true)
      --stderrthreshold severity         logs at or above this threshold go to stderr when writing to files and stderr (no effect when -logtostderr=true or -alsologtostderr=true) (default 2)
      --user string                      Specifies the user executing the operation. Useful for auditing operations executed by 3rd party tools. Defaults to the operating system username.
  -v, --v Level                          number for the log level verbosity
      --vmodule moduleSpec               comma-separated list of pattern=N settings for file-filtered logging
```

TITLE: Redis Deployment Configuration
DESCRIPTION: Kubernetes deployment configuration for Redis service with TCP port 6379.
SOURCE: https://github.com/kubernetes/minikube/blob/master/site/content/en/docs/tutorials/nginx_tcp_udp_ingress.md#2025-04-18_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: yaml
CODE:
```
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  name: redis-deployment
  namespace: default
  labels:
    app: redis
spec:
  replicas: 1
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      app: redis
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        app: redis
    spec:
      containers:
      - image: redis
        imagePullPolicy: Always
        name: redis
        ports:
        - containerPort: 6379
          protocol: TCP
```
